definition: to take over (as minister, manager etc)
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: Sobyanin confirmed as new Moscow mayor.
sentences.chinese: 普京副手索比亞寧接任莫斯科市長。

sentences.english: Philipp took on the role solely because Michael was injured.
sentences.chinese: 菲利普只是因爲米歇爾受傷了才接任隊長的。
喬治接任愛德華當隊長。

sentences.english: Kim, who took power in 1994, didn’t return to China for almost two decades.
sentences.chinese: 金，1994年接任了權力，近二十年沒有去過中國。

sentences.english: Mr Obama now has all the accoutrements of a president-in-waiting.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬已經爲接任總統做好了準備。

sentences.english: Shixian resigns as the chairman of board and asks Old Madam Hong to take over the post.
sentences.chinese: 世賢決定辭去董事長的職位，由洪老太接任。

sentences.english: But the choice of a permanent successor may be another question.
sentences.chinese: 不過選擇喬布斯的正式接任者則是另外一個問題。

sentences.english: Naoto Kan, then took over the appointment of Tatsuo Hirano play revival minister.
sentences.chinese: 菅直人隨即任命平野達男接任復興擔當大臣。

sentences.english: Inamori takes over as chairman with new president Masaru Onishi by his side.
sentences.chinese: 稻盛和夫接任董事長，尾西健則任新總裁。

sentences.english: Professor Chao-Long Chen was appointed the 3rd Superintendent of KCGMH.
sentences.chinese: 陳肇隆教授接任第三任高雄長庚醫院院長。

sentences.english: Only keep what's relevant and necessary for the person who will be doing your job next。
sentences.chinese: 只保留和你工作接任者有關的必須文件。

sentences.english: Ms . ku jui - lan takes over as head of the centers liaison division.
sentences.chinese: 編纂辜瑞蘭女士接任本中心聯絡組組長。

sentences.english: Mr. Cai will succeed Zha Xiangyang as CEO of the joint venture.
sentences.chinese: 蔡金勇將接任查向陽擔任高盛高華的首席執行長。

sentences.english: My question is who will take over president of the Foundation.
sentences.chinese: 我的問題是誰將接任該基金會主席職位。

sentences.english: Ms . keng li - chun is appointed head of the liaison division.
sentences.chinese: 編輯耿立羣女士接任本中心聯絡組組長。

sentences.english: Who will take over from Haarde is unclear.
sentences.chinese: 誰將會接任哈爾德的首相之職尚未可知。

definition: to succeed sb in a job/successor
newly-appointed/newly elected/new (in a political office)
to replace/to take over (a position or post)
to take up a post/to start in a new job
to be promoted to
to take over/to take control
to transfer/to move to another post
to leave office
to take office/to assume a post
to appoint/(job) appointment/CL:紙|纸[zhi3]
to wield (power etc)
to hold several jobs at once/concurrent post/working part-time
to leave office/to leave one's post
to take office/previous (incumbent)/predecessor
post/position/job/duties
to remain in office/to hold on to one's job
